result.execSummary:
The defendant Drew M Marley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 32 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Mark J. or his employment. St. Dominic Church, Stephanie W., Jeanette R., or Carol S. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment.   Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Drew M Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 32 days)
 consecutive
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended; 
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment  
*No contact with:  
Mark J. or his employment, St. Dominic Church, Stephanie W., Jeanette R., Carol S.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing at 02-16-2016 08:30 am
From defendant recieved 1/26/16 requesting a hearing for bail reduction.
Hearing at 02-11-2016 08:30 am

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/or St Dominic's Church listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Huber bailee status solely for the purpose to maintain his current employment.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Drew M Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.   Attorney Wolff requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Drew M Marley in court, in custody.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bail remains as fixed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Clerk of Courts office to contact Attorney Wolff's office.  Defendant allowed 2 non collect phone calls.  Hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/or St Dominic's Church listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Drew M Marley in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Attorney Wolff is appointed on underlying file.  Clerk of courts office to contact attorney Wolff.  Petition for appointment of counsel provided to the defendant.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
